poem:
The Dark Pint Awaits

The froth's rich whisper  
beckons from its glass tower,  
old black river flowing,  
where dreams are brewed  
in history's casks.  
Gilded hands measure worth—  
the liquid dark as monks' cloaks,  
its harvest—labors of the tongue.  
Yet, in the counting,  
must we lose  
the secret of its soul?
